title: I might have misunderstood "twilight of th gods"
body: the Chalicar, weapon of Setaka and now of Sivir, has also become the host of a Darkin?

replies.body: No, it's hinted that it's of Targonian origin, meaning the Aspect of Twilight was able to manipulate it's special properties as a weapon to kill Ascendeds. The story tells how upon 'activation' it sent out energy which basically varporised some Ascendeds.

then why at the end Zoe ( i suppose it's her ) takes the heart of the ex-darkin and says to bring the weapon and the hearth to a blacksmith? it's for other purposes?

to quote it:

Myisha whispered into his ear. “The power that coursed through this weapon touched you all, Ta’anari. It knows your kind now. And I give that fire to mortals.”

Her hands were inside him, and Ta’anari felt his heart being cut away, felt it being lifted from the cage of his cloven ribs... yet, still, he lived.

For a few moments more, at least.

“Idri-Mi,” she said, handing off Ta’anari’s heart, “take this and the Chalicar to your weaponsmiths. We will need to take a different approach in dealing with the rest of the...” [...]

Maybe it's to let the weaponsmitshs to learn how to make other weapons, similiar to the crossblade, that can kill and capture Darkin. The heart? one of two options: to learn how to dissolve and merge a heart into a weapon, or use it a homing device for other Darkin, like the heart in Dishonored. Like Myshia said, " It knows your kind now".
The different approach she mentions? The creation of the trick to find and capture the Darkin.

Wow. I was actually right. Crap, I didn't expect this.
Thank you for answering!

so a question a lot of people are asking is, if myisha had a spell or whatever that could kill darkin by turning them mortal, why merge them into unkillable weapons? why not use the same moon magic trick

Most likely because none of the darkin will fall for the same trick twice.

The spell didn't kill some of them the first time,why should it work on the more powerful ones?

It's both a matter of power and manipulation.
Maybe the Darkin that were captured were too strong to be killed?
Besides, the fact that Ta'anari activated the spell is something worth noting, a normal human and even an Aspect couldn't activate it without some serious damage/ death.
Moreover, let's say there's another Void breach, a really big one. Do you seriously want to kill and destroy the only ones that can hold off that kind of power and corruption?
Because the main issue is the Void (which is the reason Runeterra got the Ascended to begin with) and mortals need their power to fight it.

Myisha kind of just announces that they will need a different method of dealing with the other Darkin, without any explanation.

Possibly the writer just didn't think of it.  Likely we were not meant to question it.  Maybe they have some random explanation about why the magic could only work once.

So did Rhaast, Aatrox and Varus get imprisoned into the weapons they wielded during their reign or did they somehow get baited into using a trap weapon?

The latter is an entertaining concept.

I think it's both of them, Aatrox used his sword while he was at the top of his game, and it would also explain why he doesn't know how and why Rhaast and Varus are connected to their weapons, they are different ones that might have been used to bait and trick them in order to capture them.

More unknowns sadly. 

Even by this, Chalicar does not contain Ta'anari 's heart or him. The Aspect took his heart from his chest and then he died. No doubt they needed an Ascended's turned human heart as part of the ritual that trapped Aatrox and co in their weapons. Else why not just kill them like the others?

EDIT: Or what Gunsaint said.
